intro: Androsace vitaliana var. flosjugorum, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
